byline.contributor: Ivan Nechepurenko, Oleg Matsnev and Alexandra Odynova contributed reporting.

abstract: Debt collectors in Russia are turning to increasingly violent tactics as punishing recession fuels borrowing at high rates and mushrooming debt; worst abuses are tied to so-called microfinance industry, which issues small loans to tide strapped borrowers over until next paycheck; low-level collectors are largely unregulated and only thinly separated from organized crime.

headline.print_headline: Debt Collectors Adopt Mob Tactics as Russians Struggle to Pay Bills
headline.main: Debt Collectors Adopt Mob Tactics as Russians Struggle to Pay Bills

snippet: A culture of violence and threats flourishes as growing numbers of Russians turn to borrowing at astronomical interest rates amid a recession.
